intro: Phlox maculata f. immaculata, commonly known as the white phlox, is a cultivar of the common phlox species. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are predominantly white, lacking the typical pink or red hues of the species. This plant is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil. It produces fragrant blooms in late spring to early summer, making it a popular choice for garden borders and landscapes. Its foliage is broad-leafed and often features a slightly fuzzy texture, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
